fine_dining.name: Le Coquillage
signature_dishes: Lobster with Breton butter sauce and seasonal vegetables
Local fish with seaweed butter and wild herbs
Grand dessert selection with local honey and buckwheat
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant contemporary dining room with harbor views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least three weeks in advance, request harbor table for views
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef celebrates local Breton ingredients with innovative French techniques

fine_dining.name: Le Saint-Georges
signature_dishes: Lamb from the Ardennes with regional herbs
fine_dining.atmosphere: Rustic-elegant with natural materials and garden views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least one month in advance, worth the visit for authentic Breton cuisine
fine_dining.local_tips: Located in the heart of Rennes with a unique focus on local Breton region ingredients

fine_dining.name: Restaurant Racine
signature_dishes: Seasonal tasting menus with Breton influences
Artistic plating with local herbs and seaweed
fine_dining.atmosphere: Intimate contemporary space with open kitchen
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least two weeks in advance, opt for the surprise tasting menu
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef trained with top French chefs and creates truly innovative Breton region cuisine

fine_dining.name: Le Château de Rennes
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant château dining room with garden views
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book at least three weeks in advance, worth the visit for authentic Breton cuisine
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef creates artistic presentations inspired by the local Breton landscape

fine_dining.name: L'Atelier Breton
signature_dishes: Tasting menu blending French technique with Breton flavors
Inventive flavor combinations with local Breton ingredients
fine_dining.atmosphere: Sleek modern interior with minimalist Breton touches
fine_dining.booking_tips: Reserve at least two weeks in advance, counter seating available for kitchen views
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef creates a unique fusion of French technique with Breton region influences

casual_dining.name: La Maison Bretonne
signature_dishes: Brandade de morue (cod with olive oil)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Historic bistro with traditional Breton decor (since 1920)
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book several days ahead, especially for weekend meals
casual_dining.local_tips: A Rennes institution with authentic Breton atmosphere, worth visiting for local specialties

casual_dining.name: Crêperie Le Petit Rennes
signature_dishes: Galette complète (buckwheat crêpe with ham, egg, cheese)
casual_dining.atmosphere: Cozy traditional crêperie with Breton decor
casual_dining.booking_tips: Arrive early to avoid waiting, especially at dinner
casual_dining.local_tips: One of the most authentic crêperies in Rennes, serving traditional buckwheat galettes

casual_dining.name: Le Bistrot Breton
casual_dining.atmosphere: Contemporary bistro with simple elegant decor
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book a few days in advance, lunch menu offers great value
casual_dining.local_tips: Chef creates well-executed bistro classics with modern Breton region touches

casual_dining.name: La Table du Marché Breton
casual_dining.atmosphere: Industrial-chic with high ceilings and market views
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book for dinner, lunch is more casual, good for groups
casual_dining.local_tips: Trendy spot that transforms from casual lunch spot to vibrant evening venue

casual_dining.name: Le Petit Comptoir Breton
casual_dining.atmosphere: Small, intimate bistro with personal service
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book at least a week ahead, especially for weekends
casual_dining.local_tips: Run by local chef, offering excellent value lunch menus with market-fresh ingredients

casual_dining.name: Le Carré d'Art Breton
casual_dining.atmosphere: Modern café with views of the cathedral
casual_dining.booking_tips: Come for the view rather than the food, expect lines on weekends
casual_dining.local_tips: More about the spectacular views of the cathedral than the simple menu

casual_dining.name: Crêperie La Cathédrale Bretonne
casual_dining.atmosphere: Traditional with Breton decorations and authentic atmosphere
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book in advance for dinner, specify if you prefer indoor or outdoor seating
casual_dining.local_tips: One of Rennes' most respected crêperies, focusing on high-quality local ingredients

casual_dining.name: L'Assiette Bretonne
casual_dining.atmosphere: Modern, minimalist dining room with open kitchen
casual_dining.booking_tips: Book a week in advance, excellent value lunch menu
casual_dining.local_tips: Chef creates precise, modern dishes with excellent price-quality ratio

street_food.name: Les Halles Centrales
street_food.local_tips: Rennes' largest and most important covered market, excellent for sampling local produce

street_food.name: Carré d'Art Café
street_food.local_tips: Trendy café in the modern art museum, with terrace views of the cathedral

street_food.name: Medieval Quarter Food Stalls
street_food.local_tips: The historic heart of Rennes offers many quick food options, especially popular with students

street_food.name: La Glacerie Bretonne
street_food.local_tips: Famous regional specialty, their Breton ice cream is a must-try

street_food.name: Maison du Pain Breton
street_food.local_tips: Try the pain de Rennes, a specialty from the region rarely found elsewhere

street_food.name: Confiserie Fossier Bretonne
specialties: Biscuits roses de Rennes (traditional pink biscuits)
street_food.local_tips: Historic confectionery shop making traditional Rennes biscuits since 1756

coffee_shops.name: Café Central Breton
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Bright minimalist space with plants and large windows
coffee_shops.local_tips: One of Rennes' pioneering specialty coffee shops with excellent brunch options

coffee_shops.name: Le Petit Café Breton
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Cozy, Breton-inspired design with wooden elements
coffee_shops.local_tips: Excellent coffee paired with healthy, creative food options

coffee_shops.name: Café des Jardins Breton
coffee_shops.food_options: Breakfast options, vegetarian and vegan choices
coffee_shops.local_tips: Part café, part plant shop with a beautiful atmosphere and quality coffee

coffee_shops.name: Café Breton
coffee_shops.local_tips: Local owners bring unique Breton perspective to the Rennes coffee scene

coffee_shops.name: La Cantine du Marché Breton
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Warm industrial space with communal tables
coffee_shops.food_options: Full lunch menu with vegetarian options
coffee_shops.local_tips: Popular with local workers for lunch but also good for working remotely

bars.name: Le Carré d'Art Breton
bars.atmosphere: Modern space with 360° views of Rennes and cathedral
bars.local_tips: The rooftop terrace offers spectacular views of the cathedral; go for the views rather than the drinks

bars.name: Le Pub Irlandais Breton
bars.atmosphere: Traditional pub atmosphere with live music
bars.local_tips: Popular expat hangout with regular live music and sports screenings

bars.name: Le Lieu Unique Breton
bars.atmosphere: Industrial-chic with terrace views of the city
bars.local_tips: Cultural hub with exhibitions, performances and a great bar scene, especially in summer

bars.name: Little Breton Brewery
bars.local_tips: Local microbrewery with taproom, excellent outdoor space

bars.name: Le Café du Commerce Breton
bars.atmosphere: Classic French bistro with vintage elements
bars.local_tips: Excellent selection of natural wines and knowledgeable staff

bars.name: La Terrasse Bretonne
bars.atmosphere: Charming rooftop setting with city views
bars.local_tips: Located in the heart of the city with excellent views of the cathedral

food_tours.name: Taste of Rennes Walking Tour
food_tours.focus: Local Rennes specialties and Breton influences
food_tours.booking_tips: Morning tours recommended to experience the market at its best

food_tours.name: Breton Wine Country Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Includes transportation from Rennes, wear comfortable shoes for vineyard walking

food_tours.name: Gourmet Medieval Quarter Tour
food_tours.booking_tips: Afternoon tours available, focuses on the historic heart of the city

food_tours.name: Breton Flavors of Rennes
food_tours.booking_tips: Includes walking tour of the city, Breton focus

cooking_classes.name: L'Atelier de Marie Bretonne
cooking_classes.cuisine_focus: Traditional Breton and northern French cuisine
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Classes for all levels, focus on regional specialties

cooking_classes.name: Atelier des Chefs Rennes
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Express lunch format available, larger classes but professional setting

cooking_classes.name: Cuisine et Moi Bretonne
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Small-group experience in home kitchen setting with market visit

markets.name: Les Halles Centrales
highlights: Fresh regional produce and prepared foods
markets.local_tips: The heart of food shopping in Rennes, busiest on weekend mornings

markets.name: Marché de la Place du Marché
markets.local_tips: One of the city's largest markets, only on Saturdays but worth planning around

markets.name: Marché Biologique de la Place Saint-Felix
markets.local_tips: The place for organic and sustainable products, popular with eco-conscious locals

markets.name: Marché des Halles
markets.local_tips: Worth combining with lunch in this charming market setting

spring: White asparagus from the Brittany region
First of the season Breton wine
